page.title: 05Mixed farming
page.content: A description of a typical family-run mixed farm in this part of the Trent valley. The farm has{40 hectares}of land, divided up as follows:-{12 hectares}of grassland, to cut for hay and silage,{6.8 hectares}of sugar beet, {2.6 hectares}of oil seed rape and{4.8 {hectares}of potatoes (Records).The rape and potatoes are grown on contracted land, i.e., land which the farmer has rented out to a firm which works the land and owns the crop. The remaining land is used to support a herd of beef cattle, (Friesian, Hereford and Charolais cross-breeds) which the farmer fattens over an 18-24 month period, before taking them to market. The farmer has a herd of Large White pigs, also for fattening.
